jobicade.util.geom

Class Rect

  • java.lang.Object
    • jobicade.util.geom.Rect
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class Rect
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents an immutable axis-aligned rectangle in integer precision, typically in screen pixel space. Rectangles with nonpositive width or height are considered empty, and rectangles with negative width or height are considered denormal and may behave in strange ways. For example, union and intersection behave like each other when operating on denormal rectangles.

    Use normalize() to ensure rectangles are normal.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public static Rect empty()
        Returns an empty rectangle. Prefer to use this over creating one, as there may be a performance benefit.
        Returns:
        An empty rectangle.

      • createPadding

        public static Rect createPadding(int left,
                                 int top,
                                 int right,
                                 int bottom)
        Returns a rectangle representing padding with the origin zero. The distance of the rectangle from any side of zero is the padding on that side.
        Parameters:
        left - The left padding.
        top - The top padding.
        right - The right padding.
        bottom - The bottom padding.
        Returns:
        A rectangle representing padding.
        See Also:
        grow(Rect)

        Returns:
        A rectangle representing padding.

      • withX

        public Rect withX(int x)
        Returns a near identical rectangle with the given leftmost X coordinate. This method differs from withLeft(int) in that the width of the rectangle remains the same. There is no guarantee that the returned rectangle will be distinct from this.

        Prefer move(int, int) to change both X and Y.

        Parameters:
        x - The new leftmost X coordinate.
        Returns:
        A near identical rectangle with the given leftmost X coordinate.

      • withY

        public Rect withY(int y)
        Returns a near identical rectangle with the given leftmost Y coordinate. This method differs from withTop(int) in that the height of the rectangle remains the same. There is no guarantee that the returned rectangle will be distinct from this.

        Prefer move(int, int) to change both X and Y.

        Parameters:
        y - The new leftmost Y coordinate.
        Returns:
        A near identical rectangle with the given leftmost Y coordinate.

      • withWidth

        public Rect withWidth(int width)
        Returns a near identical rectangle with the given width. The top left position of the rectangle remains the same. There is no guarantee that the returned rectangle will be distinct from this.

        Prefer resize(int, int) to change both width and height.

        Parameters:
        width - The new width.
        Returns:
        A near identical rectangle with the given width.

      • withHeight

        public Rect withHeight(int height)
        Returns a near identical rectangle with the given height. The top left position of the rectangle remains the same. There is no guarantee that the returned rectangle will be distinct from this.

        Prefer resize(int, int) to change both width and height.

        Parameters:
        height - The new height.
        Returns:
        A near identical rectangle with the given height.

      • withLeft

        public Rect withLeft(int left)
        Returns a near identical rectangle with the given leftmost X coordinate. This method differs from withX(int) in that the rightmost X coordinate remains the same. There is no guarantee that the returned rectangle will be distinct from this.

        Prefer withLeast(int, int) to change both X and Y.

        Parameters:
        left - The new leftmost X coordinate
        Returns:
        A near copy of this rectangle with the given leftmost X coordinate

      • withTop

        public Rect withTop(int top)
        Returns a near identical rectangle with the given topmost Y coordinate. This method differs from withY(int) in that the bottommost Y coordinate remains the same. There is no guarantee that the returned rectangle will be distinct from this.

        Prefer withLeast(int, int) to change both X and Y.

        Parameters:
        top - The new topmost Y coordinate
        Returns:
        A near copy of this rectangle with the given topmost Y coordinate

        Prefer withMost(int, int) to change both width and height.

        Parameters:
        right - The new rightmost X coordinate.
        Returns:
        A near identical rectangle with the given rightmost X coordinate.

        Prefer withMost(int, int) to change both width and height.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • withLeast

        public Rect withLeast(int left,
                      int top)
        Returns a near identical rectangle with the given top left coordinate. This method differs from move(int, int) in that the bottom right coordinate remains the same. There is no guarantee that the returned rectangle will be distinct from this.

        Prefer withLeft(int) or withTop(int) to change either left or top, but not both.

        Parameters:
        left - The new leftmost X coordinate.
        top - The new topmost Y coordinate.
        Returns:
        A near identical rectangle with the given top left coordinate.

        See Also:
        withLeast(int, int)

      • withMost

        public Rect withMost(int right,
                     int bottom)
        Returns a near identical rectangle with the given bottom right coordinate. The top left coordinate remains the same. There is no guarantee that the returned rectangle will be distinct from this.

        Prefer withRight(int) or withBottom(int) to change either right or bottom, but not both.

        Parameters:
        right - The new rightmost X coordinate.
        bottom - The new bottommost Y coordinate.
        Returns:
        A near identical rectangle with the given bottom right coordinate.

      • move

        public Rect move(int x,
                 int y)
        Returns a near identical rectangle with the given top left position. This method differs from withLeast(int, int) in that the size remains the same. There is no guarantee that the returned rectangle will be distinct from this.

        Prefer withX(int) or withY(int) to change either X or Y, but not both.

        Parameters:
        x - The new leftmost X position.
        y - The new topmost Y position.
        Returns:
        A near identical rectangle with the given top left position.

      • resize

        public Rect resize(int width,
                   int height)
        Returns a near identical rectangle with the given size. The top left position remains the same. There is no guarantee that the returned rectangle will be distinct from this.

        Prefer withWidth(int) or withHeight(int) to change either width or height, but not both.

        Parameters:
        width - The new width of the rectangle.
        height - The new height of the rectangle.
        Returns:
        A near identical rectangle with the given size.

        See Also:

        Parameters:

        y - The Y coordinate offset.
        Returns:

      • translate

        public Rect translate(Direction direction,
                      int x)
        Returns the result of translating this rectangle in the given direction by the given distance. There is no guarantee that the returned rectangle will be distinct from this.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction of translation.
        x - The distance of translation.
        Returns:
        The result of translating this rectangle in the given direction by the given amount.

        y - The Y coordinate offset.

      • grow

        public Rect grow(int left,
                 int top,
                 int right,
                 int bottom)
        Adds the given padding distance to each side of the rectangle.
        Parameters:
        left - The left padding.
        top - The top padding.
        right - The right padding.
        bottom - The bottom padding.
        Returns:
        The result of padding the rectangle by the given distances.

      • grow

        public Rect grow(Rect padding)
        Adds each pair of corresponding coordinates between the two rectangles. This allows for padding to be represented by a normal rectangle, and inset to be represented by a denormal rectangle.
        Parameters:
        padding - The padding rectangle.
        Returns:
        The result of the sum of each pair of corresponding coordinates between both rectangles.
        See Also:
        createPadding(int, int, int, int)

      • grow

        public Rect grow(int padding)
        Adds a constant padding distance to each side of the rectangle.
        Parameters:
        padding - The padding distance.
        Returns:
        The result of padding the rectangle by the distance.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(int x,
                        int y)
        Tests whether the given point is inside this rectangle. Points are considered inside using the top left coordinate as an inclusive lower bound and the bottom right coordinate as an exclusive upper bound.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the point.
        y - The Y coordinate of the point.
        Returns:
        true if the point is inside this rectangle.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Point point)
        Parameters:
        point - The point.
        Returns:
        true if the point is inside this rectangle.
        See Also:
        contains(int, int)

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Tests whether the rectangle is empty. An empty rectangle is any rectangle which contains no points. Equivalently, empty rectangles are either denormal or have a width or height of zero.
        Returns:
        true if the rectangle is empty.
        See Also:
        isNormal()

      • isNormal

        public boolean isNormal()
        Tests whether the rectangle is normal. A normal rectangle has a strictly positive width and height. Denormal rectangles behave differently for certain operations, see Rect for details.
        Returns:
        true if the rectangle is normal.

      • normalize

        public Rect normalize()
        Returns an equivalent rectangle that is normal. The result must behave normally for all operations. See Rect for details.
        Returns:
        An equivalent rectangle that is normal.

      • union

        public Rect union(Rect rect)
        Returns the result of the union operation over two rectangles. The result must contain at least all points in either rectangle.

        This function behaves like intersection(Rect) on denormal rectangles.

        Parameters:
        rect - The other rectangle to union with.
        Returns:
        The result of the union operation over two rectangles.

      • intersection

        public Rect intersection(Rect rect)
        Returns the result of the intersection operation over two rectangles. The result must contain exactly all points in both rectangles.

        This function behaves like intersection(Rect) on denormal rectangles.

        Parameters:
        rect - The other rectangle to union with.
        Returns:
        The result of the union operation over two rectangles.

      • getAnchor

        public Point getAnchor(Direction direction)
        Returns the anchor point in this rectangle for a direction. For example, Direction.NORTH_WEST will return the top left coordinate.
        Parameters:
        direction - The anchor direction.
        Returns:
        The anchor point in this rectangle for the given direction.

      • align

        public Rect align(Point anchor,
                  Direction alignment)
        Aligns the given anchor direction of the rectangle with an anchor point. For example, Direction.NORTH_WEST would align the northwest corner of the rectangle with the anchor point. The size of the rectangle remains the same.
        Parameters:
        anchor - The anchor point.
        alignment - The anchor direction within the rectangle.
        Returns:
        The result of aligning the anchor direction to the anchor point.

      • anchor

        public Rect anchor(Rect container,
                   Direction direction,
                   boolean outside)
        Anchors the rectangle inside or outside another rectangle. The anchor for the given direction in the result will be the same as the same anchor in the container. The size of the rectangle remains the same.

        If outside, the anchor direction will be mirrored for this rectangle, so the result will always sit on the outside edge of the container.

        Parameters:
        container - The container to anchor to.
        direction - The direction of the anchor point.
        outside - true to align the opposite point on this rectangle to the anchor point on the container.
        Returns:
        The rectangle anchored inside or outside another rectangle.
